description: From obsolete Middle English verb devoiden, from Old French desvuidier (“to empty out”) (compare French dévider).

examples: I went searching for a knife, but the kitchen was devoid of anything sharper than a spoon.

verbs.description: devoid (third-person singular simple present devoids, present participle devoiding, simple past and past participle devoided)

examples: The child will devoid the garbage after he devours his sandwich.
